intro: Oenothera serrulata f. flava, commonly known as the yellow evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant has slender, upright stems and narrow, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. The flower's color and timing of bloom make it a distinctive and attractive species in its native environment.
